content: yet another idea how to use up left-over sock yarn… this time we are creating wee cute little hats for newborns knitted sideways using short row the hat is started with a provisional cast-on then the hat is worked in alternating colors always using one color at a time in mindless garter stitch the crown is shaped using short row with german double stitches finally the cast-on is joined with the live stitches in garter kitchener stitch for a seamless finish the pattern looks way more complicated than it is to actually work it if you know the techniques and once you have worked one hat you surely want to explore all the different color combinations from your left-over bin finished size circumference 32 cm 12 5 inch length 13 5 cm 5 25 inch to fit a head circumference of 34-38 cm or newborn to 3 months if you would like to donate hats please check with your chosen nicu about their needs before donating in the spirit of charity this pattern is available for free if you would like to thank me consider purchasing one of my other designs for yourself or for a friend or buy me a ko-fi 1 > \#arrowheadnewbornhat #stefaniebolddesign this design is also available at lovecrafts 2 follow me on instagram @stefaniebold 3 1 https //ko-fi com/stefaniebold 2 https //www lovecrafts com/de-de/search q=stefanie%20bold 3 https //www instagram com/stefaniebold/
